alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 03 at 5:36PM PDT until April 03 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM PDT FOR NORTHWESTERN IMPERIAL COUNTY... At 535 PM PDT, multiple dust channels were being generated just west of the Imperial Valley and Salton Sea. Caltrans reported near zero visibility near the intersection of SR-86 and SR-78. SR-86 remains closed. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Emergency Management. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... CA Route 78 between mile markers 1 and 13. CA Route 111 between mile markers 28 and 40, and between mile markers 42 and 64. CA Route 86 between mile markers 26 and 67. Locations impacted include... Salton City, Westmorland, Salton Sea Beach, Desert Shores, Bombay Beach, Ocotillo Wells, Calipatria, Winona, Coolidge Springs and Niland. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, then pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.
